description.title: Radboud Honours Programme for Science
contents: Writing an interdisciplinary research proposal with students from other studies in the faculty.
Expanding the bachelor thesis from 12 EC to 24 EC and opportunities for deepening research.

contents.title: VWO (Dutch Pre-University Education)
description: Highest level of dutch secondary education, prior to entering university.
Specialisation in Nature and Technology / Nature and Health
Courses in Physics (10) / Chemistry (10) / Biology (9) / Mathematics B (10) / Mathematics D (10) / Latin (10) / Spanish (10) / English (9) / Dutch (8)

contents.title: Summer-school Participant
contents.institution: The Cornell, Maryland, Max Planck Pre-doctoral Research School
description: Will engage with state-of-art Computer Science research and emerging trends in the field.
Meet and collaborate with like-minded students from all over the world.
Hosted at Max-Planck Institute for Software Science in Saarbruecken, Germany.

contents.title: Pre-University Student
contents.description: Finished 39 EC of B.S. Mathematics courses at Radboud University, while in secondary school - Calculus A (10/10, 6 EC) - Calculus B (10/10, 6 EC) - Introduction Mathematics (10/10, 6 EC) - Linear Algebra A (10/10, 3 EC) - Linear Algebra B (10/10, 3 EC) - Probability Theory (9.5/10, 3 EC) - Group Theory (10/10, 6 EC)

contents.title: Econasium Programme
contents.description: An extracurricular programme for VWO-students offered by Tilburg University, that includes a statistics course and excursions.

contents.title: Fast-lane English
contents.description: Finished programme of examination (PTA) for secondary-school English in 2 years instead of 3. This included doing my central final exam (CSE) a year ahead of schedule.

contents.title: Finalist (16th/3399) Dutch Mathematical Olympiad
contents.description: ended 16th overall and 9th in my age class (nationwide).

contents.title: Socrates Honours Award
contents.description: For being the highest-scoring (high-school GPA 9.5) newcomer to the Socrates International Honours Society of 2022. Winners are anounced in June.

contents.title: OMO Profile Project Award
contents.description: 1st place (34 schools, 2431 exam candidates). Represented Mill-Hill College with my research project on Reinforcement Learning. Received for this a prize of €1200,-

contents.title: Mención Honorı́fica
contents.institution: La Consejerı́a de Educación de la Embajada de España en Paı́ses Bajos
contents.year: A honorable mention for obtaining grade 9.6 on the central exam (CSE) for Spanish Language and Culture.

contents.title: Statistics
items: Hope to make some future blogs on optimality theory.
Would love to fit a Statistical Mechanics course into my curriculum.
Would love to take an introductory machine learning course featuring Bayesian Networks.
Will probably take a master specialized towards stochastics.

contents.title: Quantum Mechanics
items: Followed an introductory course in the first year of B.S.
Will probably follow it up with a more advanced course in the second year.

contents.title: Algorithms and Data Structures
items: Will maybe do some C implementations of data structures on my blog.

contents.title: Functional Programming
items: Have not followed the course yet, but do own the book (Programming in Haskell, Graham Hutton).
Check my GitHub repo for answers to exercises in the book.
